ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Morning pages, simple ideas, do what you love! I learned to be more free thinking and just do what comes to me.
Getting Unstuck was a great opportunity to explore creativity without suffocated academic stress.

This class provides a great exploration into creativity in all its forms. From very meta discussions about the human mind as it relates to creativity to hands on activities to engage in creative processes, these class is a must take for anyone interested in what makes up creativity. This class certainly sharpened my insights into my creative process and allowed me to be more comfortable as I thought through cognitive aspects of my thinking.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Loved the creative exercises in class (clay modeling, painting, sketching and dancing, combinatory play skits, final creative project) and the midterm interview. I also appreciated our start-of-class stretching ritual. Weaknesses: 10 am is ROUGH, and the reading responses were confusing and we didn't get feedback on them. They were cut halfway through the semester, so maybe they were deemed unhelpful? I felt planning was disorganized, and I wish that the weeks where we had long readings that we could do an activity with them or a small project).

Strengths: v chill, cool ppl attracted to the course

Weaknesses: v unorganized
The straights were the interactive activities.

This class has many strengths and few weaknesses. It is a very hands on class as it allows students to explore creativity through play, performance, and production. Additionally, the other students brought diverse perspectives and expertise from their various interests and fields. This class was well organized and each class was extremely fun! The readings and assignments contributed greatly to the overall discussions and learnings throughout the semester. Additionally, at no point was work in this class too much or burdensome, allowing students to truly explore their creative process with ease.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It's fun and we built community. It's stress-free and you'll walk away inspired in some way!
If youre looking for a gut fourth or fifth class definitely
Its a fun time. The professors are great and care about you exploring what youre interested in. Organization wise, its very spontaneous so its great if youre a flexible person.

I would strongly recommend this class to anyone at Yale but especially those who are not familiar with creative processes or the arts in general. This class is geared for all audiences and both professors strive (and succeed) to make the classroom an inclusive space for all different types of interests and fields. Taking this class was an utter joy and certainly a highlight of the classes I took at Yale.
